The Bingzhu Shuoyuan says:
Duke Ping of Jin asked Shi Kuang, saying:
I am seventy years old and want to study, but I am afraid it is too late.
He replied, If it is late, why not light a candle?
I have heard that:
Those who study when young are like the sun shining on the south side.
Those who study when strong are
like the light at midday.
Those who study when old are
like the brightness of a candle.
Who can walk in darkness?
Duke Ping said, Excellent!
The admonitions in the Fayuan zhulin say:
Now there are shallow-learning people who
consider themselves wiser than the crowd.
They give rise to great arrogance,
let loose their appearance,
and trample on everything.
They cover the heavens and earth.
They sit with legs crossed in front of their teachers and elders.
Roaring beside the Venerable One.
The Way is originally harmonious.
Respect and obedience are the Sangha.
Since the mind and appearance are contrary,
How can it be a treasure?
